title: Calories in Scotch Whiskey
meta_description: Discover calories in scotch whiskey per standard shot, including alcohol content, zero carbs or protein, and tips for variations without mixers.
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) serving of 40% ABV scotch whisky, neat, no mixers or additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof (ABV), serving size, and any additions; alcohol content affects calorie density. Consult labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One standard shot of scotch whiskey contains about 97 calories, primarily from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one shot of scotch whiskey?
faqs.a: About 97 calories for a 1.5 oz (44 ml) shot at 40% ABV.

faqs.q: Does scotch whiskey have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No, scotch whiskey has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars per shot—calories are from alcohol only.

faqs.q: Calories in scotch whiskey vs. other whiskeys?
faqs.a: Similar across whiskeys at same ABV; scotch is typically 40-46% ABV, yielding 70-110 kcal per shot.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in scotch whiskey?
faqs.a: Higher proof (ABV) increases calories; e.g., 50% ABV adds ~24 kcal per shot compared to 40%.

faqs.q: Are there any nutrients besides calories in scotch whiskey?
faqs.a: Essentially none—0 g protein, fat, sodium, or cholesterol; it's pure alcohol calories.
